tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency Well the actual source is actually us, the consumers, who are flushing or washing microplastics down our drains. Water companies are just one of the many pathways to the environment where we have an opportunity to try and capture it.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency You should be holding your P45 on that photo, completely failed the people of Newcastle under Lyme. Can't decide if you  and Dinnis are totally incompetent  or are taking backhanders.
I dare you to come to Newcastle and smell for yourself.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What, are you for real @AaronBell4NUL have you read this, they are taking mickey out of every one of us, who can't step outside our front door or even open a window without being gasses #stopthestink

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Well thanks to your agency‚Äôs poor monitoring of the Walley‚Äôs Quarry landfill, I could only remain digging at my allotment patch for one hour and head to leave as the noxious odour from the landfill gave me a headache.    It receded once I returned indoors.
@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Must be nice to be able to do that Mr. Bevan, in an environment not plagued by the stench of a landfill like that I n Newcastle under Lyme.
@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA where should people from Silverdale go for fresh air I'm the nature,  should we all come to London? The air around here is toxic. @StinkStopthe #WalleysQuarry
@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Not having to deal with the @EnvAgency would improve my mental health.

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What of the folks in #NewcastleunderLyme, unable to 'connect with nature' due to the foul stench emanating from #WalleysQuarry Landfill?
You tweet about #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek but fail to connect locals MH issues with the EA's own inaction. Unbelievable! :-(

@EnvAgencyMids were you onsite when this happened? What would have happened had you not been there? https://t.co/P8Bf6y2yWe

@EnvAgencyMids To be crystal clear @ClareDinnisEA As if you didn‚Äôt know - this is NOT just an odour! Stop gaslighting the health effects from a toxic gas!! @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice

@SianieRoo @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice Well said @SianieRoo  @ClareDinnisEA  minimising the truth IT‚ÄôS NOXIOUS GAS that has an odour
@HelenVi00175623 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency With such gems as we're not accepting Waste at present and it must be someone else emitting hydrogen slufide hopefully it will be
@davemh72 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency I'm hoping against hope it's a case of 'enough rope'  by Red Industries üôèüôè
@HelenVi00175623 @SOPH_C_ @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency yes but don't forget who we're dealing with ,@EnvAgency more spine in a jellyfish
@davemh72 @SOPH_C_ Surely misrepresenting what the @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency actually said should land them in a heap of trouble or you would hope so.
üëèüèª@AaronBell4NUL absolutely lamentable response over a long period from @EnvAgencyMids this goes right to the top of that organisation. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/kPOFXOlFbz

@EnvAgencyMids Clearly you are lining each others pockets but when court cases begin you will be throwing each other under the bus. Keep this post and look at it on the morning you are called to the dock. There are things that you are not privy to and believe people will be jailed. Enjoy.

This #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek we‚Äôve been encouraging @envagency staff to get out and safely connect with #nature during their lunch break - whether that‚Äôs in their own garden, a local park, a forest or the countryside. https://t.co/nwdvg1p4ls

tweets.text: Lovely Foambergs on the River Ure at Boroughbridge this morning @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/U6732083pC

The @EnvAgency clearly doesn't have enough funds or boots on the ground to tackle this. Gov't needs to stump up, and polluters should pay. In the meantime, if you see muck pollution, please report it to the EA: 0800 807060. And share your photos. /4
